p: The tree topologies from env in the 3’ end of the genome (segments 8–11) support the previous hypothesis [ 12] that this region came from a virus in the SIV mon/-mus/-gsn clade. These viruses form a clear sister clade to SIV cpz with high posterior support ( Fig 2C and 2D). We find strong evidence for transmissions from mona monkeys (SIV mon) to mustached monkeys (SIV mus), and from mustached monkeys to greater spot-nosed monkeys (SIV gsn) (see Discussion of potential coevolution below). We also find more evidence in support of a transmission from mona monkeys to chimpanzees than from the other two potential donors, but more sampling is required to firmly resolve which of these viruses was the original donor of the 3’ end of SIV cpz.
